questions.prompt: In BG 2.2, what does Krsna point out to sad Arjuna?
choices: His sword is too heavy for him to carry properly during battle
He is acting weak and sad even though he is a great warrior
His clothes are torn and need to be repaired before the battle
His horse is tired from the long journey to the battlefield today
questions.feedback: Krsna tells Arjuna that he is being weak and sad when he should be brave and strong.

questions.prompt: Srila Prabhupada explains three ways to understand God using the example of the sun. Which is the highest understanding?
choices: Understanding the sunshine like knowing God's energy everywhere around us
Seeing the sun's surface from far away like some yogis do
Actually entering the sun planet like devotees who know God personally
All three are exactly the same with no difference at all
questions.feedback: Devotees know Krsna personally, like someone who enters the sun planet. This is the highest understanding.

questions.prompt: What does Arjuna do in BG 2.7?
choices: He tells Krsna to go away and leave him alone right now completely
He gets angry with Krsna and argues with him angrily and loudly
He asks Krsna to teach him what the right thing to do is
He surrenders completely without wanting to understand anything more at all
questions.feedback: Arjuna is confused and asks Krsna to teach him because he knows Krsna is wise.

questions.prompt: According to Srila Prabhupada's explanation of BG 2.7, what makes someone miserly or foolish?
choices: Not having enough money or possessions in this material world
Wasting their human life like cats and dogs without learning about the soul
Always helping their family members in every situation they face
Being very smart and educated in school subjects and topics
questions.feedback: A foolish person wastes their life without learning about the soul. Humans should understand who they really are and God.

questions.prompt: According to BG 2.13, what happens as we grow from young to old?
choices: We become a different person each time we grow older
We stay exactly the same throughout our entire life
Our body changes but we remain the same person inside
We are a new person every day of our life
questions.feedback: Your body changes from baby to adult, but you stay the same person inside. You don't become someone new.

questions.prompt: In Srila Prabhupada's explanation of BG 2.13, why are Krsna and Arjuna different?
choices: Both are exactly the same and have the same great powers always
Krsna is the Supreme Lord and Arjuna is a soul who can forget
Arjuna is greater than Krsna in spiritual power and supreme knowledge
Both are ordinary people with no special qualities at all whatsoever
questions.feedback: Krsna is God and never forgets. Arjuna is like us and can get confused. So Krsna teaches him.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.20, what does Krsna teach about the soul?
choices: The soul is born and dies with the body always
The soul is not born and cannot die; it is eternal
The soul lives only for a few years of life
Only rich people have a soul in their bodies
questions.feedback: Krsna teaches that the soul inside us never dies and was never born. It is eternal and forever.

questions.prompt: Srila Prabhupada explains how we know the soul is present. What is the sign?
choices: The body's weight and size show the soul as explained here
Being conscious and aware shows the soul is there
Only doctors with special machines can detect the soul
The soul has no sign and cannot be known
questions.feedback: Being aware and conscious is the sign of the soul. Your awareness shows your soul is present in your body.

questions.prompt: What is special about doing the right duty without expecting rewards?
choices: It is bad and you should not do it ever
It is boring and a waste of your time completely
It is good and keeps you free from bad results
You should always expect rewards for your actions
questions.feedback: When you do what is right without worrying about getting rewards, it keeps you happy and free from harm.

questions.prompt: According to Srila Prabhupada's explanation of BG 2.46, what is the real purpose of studying the Vedas?
choices: To become very rich and powerful in this world
To learn magic tricks and impress people
To understand Krsna and serve Him with love
Only to perform rituals without understanding anything
questions.feedback: The Vedas help us know Krsna. Everything we learn should help us understand and love God.
